alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 11:10AM CDT until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting East Baton Rouge, West Feliciana and Pointe Coupee Parishes. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge, Donaldsonville, Reserve, New Orleans...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Red River Landing. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 51.0 feet, All river islands along the reach from Red River Landing to Baton Rouge will be inundated. Recreational camps and river bottom farm land will be under water. At 54.0 feet, All river islands along the reach from Red River Landing to Baton Rouge will be inundated. Recreational camps and river bottom land will be under water. Water approaches Angola farm land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 48.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Monday was 48.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Monday afternoon and it will quickly bounce back up above flood stage late Thursday night and continue rising to a crest of 53.0 feet Saturday, April 08. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 53.5 feet on 05/21/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana
